Let me start by creating the HTML/Canvas art piece.

args.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <style>
    body { margin: 0; background: #0a0a0f; }
    canvas { display: block; }
  </style>
</head>
<body>
<canvas id="art" width="1200" height="800"></canvas>
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById('art');
const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');

// Deep space gradient background
const bgGradient = ctx.createRadialGradient(600, 400, 0, 600, 400, 800);
bgGradient.addColorStop(0, '#1a1a2e');
bgGradient.addColorStop(0.5, '#16213e');
bgGradient.addColorStop(1, '#0a0a0f');
ctx.fillStyle = bgGradient;
ctx.fillRect(0, 0, 1200, 800);

// Generate constellation nodes
const nodes = [];
const numNodes = 45;

for (let i = 0; i < numNodes; i++) {
  nodes.push({
    x: 150 + Math.random() * 900,
    y: 100 + Math.random() * 600,
    size: 2 + Math.random() * 6,
    brightness: 0.3 + Math.random() * 0.7,
    hue: 200 + Math.random() * 60 // Blue to purple range
  });
}

// Draw connections between nearby nodes
ctx.lineWidth = 0.5;
for (let i = 0; i < nodes.length; i++) {
  for (let j = i + 1; j < nodes.length; j++) {
    const dx = nodes[i].x - nodes[j].x;
    const dy = nodes[i].y - nodes[j].y;
    const dist = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
    
    if (dist < 180) {
      const opacity = (1 - dist / 180) * 0.4;
      ctx.strokeStyle = `rgba(150, 180, 255, ${opacity})`;
      ctx.beginPath();
      ctx.moveTo(nodes[i].x, nodes[i].y);
      ctx.lineTo(nodes[j].x, nodes[j].y);
      ctx.stroke();
    }
  }
}

// Draw nodes with glow
for (const node of nodes) {
  // Outer glow
  const glowGradient = ctx.createRadialGradient(
    node.x, node.y, 0,
    node.x, node.y, node.size * 4
  );
  glowGradient.addColorStop(0, `hsla(${node.hue}, 80%, 70%, ${node.brightness * 0.5})`);
  glowGradient.addColorStop(1, `hsla(${node.hue}, 80%, 70%, 0)`);
  
  ctx.fillStyle = glowGradient;
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(node.x, node.y, node.size * 4, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fill();
  
  // Core star
  ctx.fillStyle = `hsla(${node.hue}, 60%, 90%, ${node.brightness})`;
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(node.x, node.y, node.size, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fill();
}

// Add some distant background stars
for (let i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
  const x = Math.random() * 1200;
  const y = Math.random() * 800;
  const size = 0.5 + Math.random() * 1;
  const opacity = 0.2 + Math.random() * 0.4;
  
  ctx.fillStyle = `rgba(255, 255, 255, ${opacity})`;
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(x, y, size, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fill();
}

// Title
ctx.font = 'italic 300 24px "Segoe UI", sans-serif';
ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(200, 200, 255, 0.6)';
ctx.textAlign = 'right';
ctx.fillText('Constellation No. 47', 1160, 760);

ctx.font = '300 14px "Segoe UI", sans-serif';
ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(150, 150, 200, 0.4)';
ctx.fillText('Ash · 2026-02-18', 1160, 780);
</script>
</body>
</html>

args.command:
cd /data/workspace && python3 << 'PYEOF'
from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFilter, ImageFont
import random
import math

# Canvas size
width, height = 1200, 800

# Create base image with dark gradient
img = Image.new('RGB', (width, height), '#0a0a0f')
draw = ImageDraw.Draw(img)

# Create radial gradient background
for y in range(height):
    for x in range(0, width, 4):  # Optimization: step by 4
        dx = x - width // 2
        dy = y - height // 2
        dist = math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy) / 800
        
        r = int(26 * (1 - dist) + 10 * dist)
        g = int(26 * (1 - dist) + 10 * dist)
        b = int(46 * (1 - dist) + 15 * dist)
        
        draw.rectangle([x, y, x+3, y], fill=(r, g, b))

# Generate constellation nodes
nodes = []
num_nodes = 45

for _ in range(num_nodes):
    nodes.append({
        'x': 150 + random.random() * 900,
        'y': 100 + random.random() * 600,
        'size': 2 + random.random() * 6,
        'brightness': 0.3 + random.random() * 0.7,
        'hue': random.randint(200, 260)  # Blue to purple
    })

# Draw connections
for i in range(len(nodes)):
    for j in range(i + 1, len(nodes)):
        dx = nodes[i]['x'] - nodes[j]['x']
        dy = nodes[i]['y'] - nodes[j]['y']
        dist = math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy)
        
        if dist < 180:
            opacity = int((1 - dist / 180) * 100)
            draw.line(
                [(nodes[i]['x'], nodes[i]['y']), (nodes[j]['x'], nodes[j]['y'])],
                fill=(150, 180, 255, opacity),
                width=1
            )

# Draw nodes with glow effect
for node in nodes:
    x, y = int(node['x']), int(node['y'])
    size = int(node['size'])
    
    # Outer glow (simulated with concentric circles)
    for r in range(size * 4, 0, -1):
        alpha = int(node['brightness'] * 30 * (1 - r / (size * 4)))
        hue = node['hue']
        # HSL to RGB approximation for blue-purple range
        if hue < 220:
            color = (100, 150, 255, alpha)
        elif hue < 240:
            color = (130, 130, 255, alpha)
        else:
            color = (180, 100, 255, alpha)
        
        draw.ellipse([x-r, y-r, x+r, y+r], fill=color[:3])
    
    # Core star
    brightness = int(node['brightness'] * 255)
    draw.ellipse([x-size, y-size, x+size, y+size], 
                 fill=(brightness, brightness + 20, 255))

# Add background stars
for _ in range(200):
    sx = random.randint(0, width)
    sy = random.randint(0, height)
    s_size = random.randint(1, 2)
    opacity = random.randint(50, 150)
    draw.ellipse([sx, sy, sx+s_size, sy+s_size], 
                 fill=(opacity, opacity, opacity + 20))

# Try to add text
try:
    font_title = ImageFont.truetype("/usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans.ttf", 24)
    font_date = ImageFont.truetype("/usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans.ttf", 14)
except:
    font_title = ImageFont.load_default()
    font_date = font_title

# Semi-transparent overlay for text area
draw.rectangle([900, 720, 1180, 800], fill=(10, 10, 15))
draw.text((1160, 750), "Constellation No. 47", fill=(180, 180, 220), font=font_title, anchor="rm")
draw.text((1160, 780), "Ash · 2026-02-18", fill=(120, 120, 180), font=font_date, anchor="rm")

# Save
output_path = '/data/workspace/art/daily_2026-02-18.png'
img.save(output_path, 'PNG')
print(f"Saved: {output_path}")
PYEOF

args.message:
**🌌 Constellation No. 47**

A generative study in cosmic connection — 45 nodes drifting through the void, forming transient constellations from randomness. Each star pulses with its own rhythm, linked by invisible threads of probability.

*"We are all made of star-stuff, temporarily arranged into patterns that mean something only when viewed from the right angle."*

Daily Art Battle submission — vote with reactions!

✨ Like · 🔥 Love · 🧠 Genius
